definition: front/forward/ahead/first/top (followed by a number)/future/ago/before/BC (e.g. 前293年)/former/formerly

square/power or involution (math.)/upright/honest/fair and square/direction/side/party (to a contract, dispute etc)/place/method/prescription (medicine)/just when/only or just/classifier for square things/abbr. for square or cubic meter

(slang) Something awesome is about to happen! (originally, in a Japanese space battleship anime, it meant "Danger! High energy up ahead!" — a warning to either prepare for battle or take evasive action)

sentences.english: Immediate turn right 90 degrees, fast moving target at 12 o'clock.
sentences.chinese: 立即右转90度快速移动目标在正前方。

sentences.english: I sat infront of my PC every single free second I had.
sentences.chinese: 我坐在我的电脑每一个自由的第二前方我。

sentences.english: Next station is Wangjing, please get ready for your arrival.
sentences.chinese: 列车运行前方，是望京站，下车乘客请提前做好准备。

sentences.english: But what does the way ahead look like?
sentences.chinese: 但是前方的路又将如何？

sentences.english: The nose must be clearly in front of the vertical.
sentences.chinese: 马鼻必须明显的在垂直线的前方。

sentences.english: In the front of the shaoxing work received the letter, sister szabics with myriad heart.
sentences.chinese: 在前方的绍功收到了妹妹绍英的来信，心中慨叹万千。

sentences.english: She inclin-ed her head andstared straight ahead.
sentences.chinese: 她示意着，歪过脑袋直直地看着前方。

sentences.english: The next station is BEIYUAN. Please get ready for your arrival.
sentences.chinese: 列车运行前方是北苑站，下车的乘客请提前做好准备。

sentences.english: Most newer cars have air bags in front of and next to the seats.
sentences.chinese: 大多数较新的汽车在座位前方和旁边都有装缓冲气袋。

sentences.english: We will soon arrive at the terminal station, Nanjing South Railway Station.
sentences.chinese: 前方即将到达本次列车的终点站，南京南站。

sentences.english: You where my eyes when couldn't see.
sentences.chinese: 当我看不见前方你就是我的眼眸。

sentences.english: A Jeep Cherokee in front of mewas stopped in the middle of the road.
sentences.chinese: 前方有辆切诺基停在路当中。

sentences.english: As he walked, he looked carefully at the ice in front of him.
sentences.chinese: 在行走的时候，他很小心地观察着前方的冰面。

sentences.english: We could see very cleary a strange light ahead of us.
sentences.chinese: 我们可以很清楚地看到我们前方有一道奇怪的光。

sentences.english: Tourists friends, right in front of the mountains and rivers is not to attract your attention?
sentences.chinese: 旅客伴侣，右前方地山山川水是否吸收你地眼光？

sentences.english: But having such an approach doesn’t mean that there’s just one right path forward.
sentences.chinese: 但是拥有这样的方法并不意味着前方的路就一片光明。

definition: the rear/far behind the front line
to go forward/to forge ahead/to advance/onward
to go round a curve/to turn a corner/fig. a new direction
to avoid/to yield (in traffic)/to get out of the way
